contextId.occurrenceNote: Elizabeth's pregnancy was proof that God was able to do anything—even enable Mary to become pregnant without her sleeping with a man. The double negatives in this statement can be stated with positive terms. Alternate translation: "God can do anything" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: nothing will be impossible for God

contextId.occurrenceNote: The double negative can be replaced. Alternate translation: "near the house" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: οὐ μακρὰν ἀπέχοντος ἀπὸ τῆς οἰκίας

contextId.occurrenceNote: This double negative means "continues to believe in me despite" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: not stop believing in me because of

contextId.occurrenceNote: This double negative can be written as a positive statement. Alternate translation: "everything that is hidden will be made known" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: οὐ ... ἐστιν κρυπτὸν ὃ οὐ φανερὸν γενήσεται
contextId.glQuote: nothing is hidden that will not be made known

contextId.occurrenceNote: This double negative can be written as a positive statement. Alternate translation: "and everything that is secret will be made known and will come into the light" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: nor is anything secret that will not be known and come into the light

contextId.occurrenceNote: This could be stated with positive verbs. Alternate translation: "If anyone wants to be my disciple, he must carry his own cross and follow me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: ὅστις οὐ βαστάζει τὸν σταυρὸν αὐτοῦ καὶ ἔρχεται ὀπίσω μου, οὐ δύναται εἶναί μου μαθητής
contextId.glQuote: Whoever does not carry his own cross and come after me cannot be my disciple

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with positive verbs. Alternate translation: "only those of you who give up all that you have can be my disciples" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: any one of you who does not give up all that he has cannot be my disciple

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is the end of the sentence that begins with the words "there is no one who has left ... kingdom of God" (verse 28). This could be stated in positive form. "everyone who has left ... kingdom of God will receive" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
